item.title: Mary add a quote by Laertius, Diogenes
item.description: "A man should live with his superiors as he does with fire: not too near lest he burn; nor too far lest he freeze" -- Laertius, Diogenes

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There are books full of great writing that don't have very good stories. Read sometimes for the story... don't be like the book-snobs who won't do that. Read sometimes for the words--the language. Don't be like the play-it-safers who won't do that. But when you find a book that has both a good story and good words, treasure that book." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The most important things are the hardest to say. They are the things you get ashamed of, because words diminish them -- words shrink things that seemed limitless when they were in your head to no more than living size when they're brought out. But it's more than that, isn't it? The most important things lie too close to wherever your secret heart is buried, like landmarks to a treasure your enemies would love to steal away. And you may make revelations that cost you dearly only to have people look at you in a funny way, not understanding what you've said at all, or why you thought it was so important that you almost cried while you were saying it. That's the worst, I think. When the secret stays locked within not for want of a tellar but for want of an understanding ear." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The beauty of religious mania is that it has the power to explain everything. Once God (or Satan) is accepted as the first cause of everything which happens in the mortal world, nothing is left to chance...logic can be happily tossed out the window." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "That wasn't any act of God. That was an act of pure human fuckery." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If I have to spend time in purgatory before going to one place or the other, I guess I'll be all right as long as there's a lending library." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Schizoid behavior is a pretty common thing in children. It's accepted, because all we adults have this unspoken agreement that children are lunatics." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Come to a book as you would come to an unexplored land. Come without a map. Explore it, and draw your own map.... A book is like a pump. It gives nothing unless first you give to it. " -- Stephen King

item.title: Mary add a quote by King, Stephen
item.description: "Do it for joy and you can do it forever" -- King, Stephen
